children.judul: Supporting Multilingual Information Retrieval in Web Applications: An English-Chinese Web Portal Experiment
children.peneliti: Jialun Qin, Yilu Zhou, Michael Chau, Hsinchun Chen
children.masalah: Evaluating a multilingual web
children.deskripsi_masalah: Developing and evaluating a multilingual English-Chinese Web portal in the business domain with CLIR and MLIR.
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
The AI Lab SpidersRUs toolkit is used to build the English and Chinese collections for the Web portal. Each collection consists of about 100,000 IT business Web pages.
We built our own lexicon for the IT business domain in both English and Chinese.
children.deskripsi_metode:
A dictionary-based approach has been adopted that combines phrasal translation, co-occurrence analysis, and pre- and post-translation query expansion
Phrasal translations and co-occurrence analysis were also implemented.
children.hasil:
All methods except word-by-word get over 70% performance in monolingual system.
Phrasal and co-occurrence disambiguation performed much better than word-by-word translation, achieving a 74.6% improvement.
Pre and post-translation expansion did not improve the performance.

children.judul: Improving Interactive Retrieval by Combining Ranked Lists and Clustering
children.peneliti: Anton Leuski, James Allan
children.masalah: Organizing the documents
children.deskripsi_masalah: Organizing the documents returned by an information retrieval system in response to a natural language query.
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
TREC ad-hoc queries that ran against the documents in TREC volumes 2 and 4 (2.1GB) that include articles from Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, and Federal Register.
Relevance judgments supplied by NIST accessors (Harman & Voorhees, 1997)
children.metode: Ranked list, clustering of the results
children.deskripsi_metode:
Ranked list, clustering of the results.
evaluate by comparing to the ranked list and interactive relevance feedback search strategies.
children.hasil:
Significantly exceeds the initial performance of the ranked list
and rivals in its effectiveness the traditional relevance feedback methods.

children.judul: Using Citations to Generate surveys of Scientific Paradigms
children.peneliti: Saif Mohammad, Bonnie Dorr, Melissa Egan, Ahmed Hassan,Pradeep Muthukrishan, Vahed Qazvinian, Dragomir Radev, David Zajic
children.masalah: Automatically generated survey
children.deskripsi_masalah: First steps in producing an automatically generated, readily consumable, technical survey.
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
The ACL Anthology is a collection of papers.
Evaluation experiments are on a set of papers in the research area of Question Answering (QA)and another set of papers on Dependency parsing(DP).
children.metode: Bibliometric lexical link mining and summarization techniques
children.deskripsi_metode:
Combining bibliometric lexical link mining and summarization techniques
Four summarization systems for survey-creation approach: Trimmer,LexRank, C-LexRank, and C-RR.
For this we evaluated using : nugget-based pyramid evaluation and ROUGE
children.hasil: Both citation texts and abstracts have unique survey-worthy information. Multidocument summarization especially technical survey creation—benefits considerably from citation texts.

children.judul: Multi-document Summarization by Graph Search and Matching
children.peneliti: Inderjeet Mani, Eric Bloedorn
children.masalah: Summarize multiple documents
children.deskripsi_masalah: Summarize the similarities and differences in information content among multiple documents in a way that is sensitive to the needs of the user.
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
Four queries from the TREC (Harman 1994) collection of topics, with the idea of exploiting their associated (binary) relevance judgments.
For this experiment, 15 pairs of articles on international events were selected from searches on the World Wide Web.
children.deskripsi_metode: Graph representation by making abstract content representation based on explicitly representing entities and the relations between entities, of the sort that can be robustly extracted by current information extraction systems.
children.hasil:
Summaries were used, the performance was faster than with fulltext (F=32.36, p < 0.05, using analysis of variance F-test) without significant loss of accuracy.
Shorter texts are effective enough to support accurate retrieval.
The biggest improvement comes from the differences found using spreading

children.judul: Resolving Ambiguity for Cross-language Retrieval
children.peneliti: Lisa Ballesteros, W. Bruce Croft
children.masalah: Resolving Ambiguity for Cross-language Retrieval
children.deskripsi_masalah:
One of the main hurdles to improved CLIR effectiveness is resolving ambiguity associated with translation.

Resources for cross-language retrieval can require tremendous manual effort to generate and may be difficult to acquire. Therefore methods which capitalize on existing resources must be
found.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Evaluation was performed on the 748 MB TREC AP English collection (having 243K documents covering ’88-’90) with provided relevance judgments. Co-occurrence statistics were collected from the portion of the AP collection covering 1989.
children.deskripsi_metode:
Technique based on cooccurrence statistics from unlinked corpora which can be used to reduce the ambiguity associated with phrasal and term translation.
Employ parallel corpus analysis to look at the impact of query term disambiguation on CLIR effectiveness.
children.hasil: Combining corpus analysis techniques can be used to disambiguate terms and phrases. In combination with query expansion, it significantly reduces the error associated with query translation. Techniques based on unlinked corpora can perform as well or better than techniques based on more complex or scarce resources. Our co-occurrence method was better at disambiguating queries than was our parallel corpus technique.

children.judul: Word Sense Disambiguation with a Corpus-based Semantic Network
children.peneliti: Qujiang Peng, Takeshi Ito, Teiji Furugori
children.masalah: WSD
children.deskripsi_masalah: Determining the meaning of words in text is by Word sense disambiguation (WSD)
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
We tested our method for the same 10 
polysemous words used in our previous 
work with 756 instances collected and other materials.
children.deskripsi_metode: Uses a corpus-based semantic network.   Creating a semantic network that represents semantic distances among words in general, we resolve the ambiguities activating the network.
children.hasil: Achieved a success rate of 92.1%, which is better than those of other comparable

nodes.sumbu_x: Senseval-2 fine-grained English testing corpus and SemEval 2007 Task 7 coarse-grained testing corpus.

children.judul: Word Sense Disambiguation with Automatically Acquired Knowledge
children.peneliti: Ping Chen, Wei Ding, Max Choly, Chris Bowes
children.masalah: WSD that applied in any real world applications
children.deskripsi_masalah: WSD that applied in any real world applications with automatically acquired knowledge
children.domain_data: Senseval-2 fine-grained English testing corpus and SemEval 2007 Task 7 coarse-grained testing corpus.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Testing with two large scale WSD evaluation corpora, Senseval-2 fine-grained English testing corpus and SemEval 2007 Task 7 coarse-grained testing corpus.
children.deskripsi_metode:
1) Corpus building through search engines
2) Document cleaning
3) Sentence segmentation
4) Parsing
5) Dependency relation merging
6) Dependency relation normalization
children.hasil:
Achieves 82.64% in both precision and recall, which clearly outperforms the best unsupervised WSD system and performs similarly as the best supervised system
Our WSD method overcomes the knowledge acquisition bottleneck faced by many current WSD systems. Our main finding is the “greater-sum” disambiguation capability of these three knowledge sources,the SemEval-2007 and Senseval-2 corpora

children.judul: An Efficient Linear Text Segmentation Algorithm Using Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering
children.peneliti: Ji-Wei Wu
children.masalah:
Efficient linear text 
segmentation
children.deskripsi_masalah:
Efficient linear text 
segmentation algorithm based on hierarchical agglomerative 
clustering
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
Test corpus consists of 700 samples. A 
sample is a concatenation of ten text segments. The 700 samples are divided into 4 sets according to the range of the number of sentences
children.deskripsi_metode:
Tokenization, stopword removal, 
and stemming. After text preprocessing, the text can be represented 
as vectors, each of which represents a sentence within the 
text. A part of sentence similarities are then computed to 
construct the sentence-similarity matrix. Finally, the optimal 
topic boundaries are identified by the proposed algorithm.
children.hasil:
Linear text segmentation 
algorithm (i.e., TSHAC) outperforms the linear time algorithm, TextTiling. TSHAC also provides comparable results with other algorithms. TSHAC provides a fully automatic process for linear text segmentation without auxiliary knowledge base, parameter setting, or user involvement.

nodes.sumbu_x: AP Newswire, Federal Register, DOE abstracts

children.judul: The Effects of Query Structure and Dictionary Setups in Dictionary-Based Cross-language Information Retrieval
children.peneliti: Ari Pirkola
children.masalah: Effects of query structure and various setups of translation dictionaries on the performance of cross-language information retrieval (CLIR)
children.deskripsi_masalah: In this study, the effects of query structure and various setups of translation dictionaries on the performance of cross-language information retrieval (CLIR) were tested.
children.domain_data: AP Newswire, Federal Register, DOE abstracts
children.deskripsi_domain_data: The test collection consisted of the AP Newswire, Federal Register, and DOE abstracts subsets of the TREC collection.
children.metode: Combine general language MRD and a domain specific MRD
children.deskripsi_metode:
The translation polysemy and the dictionary coverage problems were attacked by means of the combination of a general language MRD and a domain specific MRD
.
children.hasil:
There was only a slight difference in performance between the original English queries and the best cross-language queries.
A cross-language IR system based on MRD translation is able to achieve the performance level of a monolingual system, if queries are structured and if both general terminology and domain spe- cific terminology are available in translation.

children.judul: A New Approach to Feature Selection in Text Classification
children.peneliti: Yi Wang, Xiao-Jing Wang
children.masalah: New approach to feature selection to do feature reduction
children.deskripsi_masalah: New approach to feature selection to do feature reduction, which is a constituent process in representing texts.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Divide the corpus into two non-intersected sets: a training set containing 10 categories with 100 texts in each and a test set containing the same 10 categories with another 100 texts in each also
children.deskripsi_metode: Variance-mean based feature filtering method of feature selection to do feature reduction in the representation phase.
children.hasil: Variance-mean method can gain higher performance at a very low dimension, and quickly reach a peak, which means much less computing time and almost best performance than DF, CHI.

nodes.sumbu_x: Five test data sets(CACM, MED, EXC, PEO and TOP)

children.judul: Text Clustering with Feature Selection by Using Statistical Data
children.peneliti: Yanjun Li, Congnan Luo, Soon M. Chung
children.masalah:
Extended the X2 term-category indepen-
dence test
children.deskripsi_masalah: Extended the X2 term-category independence test by introducing new statistical data that can measure whether the dependency between a term and a category is positive or negative, developed a new supervised feature selection method, named CHIR, which is based on the X2 statistic and the new term-category dependency measure.
children.domain_data: Five test data sets(CACM, MED, EXC, PEO and TOP)
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
Two data sets,CACM and MED, are extracted from the CACM and MEDLINE abstracts, respectively, which are included in the Classic database. Additional three data sets, EXC, PEO and TOP,are from the EXCHANGES, PEOPLE and TOPICS category sets
of the Reuters-21578 Distribution 1.0
children.deskripsi_metode: Text Clustering with Feature Selection (TCFS), which performs the clustering and the supervised feature selection alternately until convergence.
children.hasil: CHIR consistently out-performs other three methods in terms of increasing the cohesiveness values of the clusters.

children.judul: Clustering-Based Feature Selection in Semi-supervised Problems
children.peneliti: Ianisse Quinzán, José M. Sotoca, Filiberto Pla
children.masalah: Unlabeled information can improve significant classification result
children.deskripsi_masalah: Unlabeled information can improve significant classification result
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
Gisette is a big data in the UCI repository, with 5000 attributes and 13500 objects, 7000 of them labelled. Optdigits problem is about the recognition of a handwritten number. The database has 5620 samples and 64 features.Covtype database, the objective is predicting forest 
cover type from cartographic variables, with no remotely sensed data. This database has 54 features, 581012 objects and 7 classes. A hyperspectral image called 92AV3C corresponding to a spectral image (145 x 145 pixels, 220 bands, and 17 classes).
children.metode:
Hybrid method (combines supervised and 
unsupervised measures of information)
children.deskripsi_metode:
A new hybrid method for semi-supervised 
problem which combines supervised and unsupervised measures of information. This approach applies a strategy to obtain a feature subset through clustering techniques.
children.hasil:
The unsupervised information improves the accuracy and the ssfc method is adequate.
Optdigits is a database where sup technique gets high-quality features for few labeled samples. Thus, in this case 
the ssfc has similar performance than sup. Nevertheless when the number of labeled samples is increased, ssfc and sup become similar to supT.

children.judul: A Discrete Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm for Domain Independent Linear Text Segmentation
children.peneliti: Ji-Wei Wu, Judy C.R. Tseng, Wen-Nung Tsai
children.masalah: Improve the performance of linear text segmentation
children.deskripsi_masalah: Improve the performance of linear text segmentation
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Choi test corpus consists of 700 samples. A sample is a concatenation of ten text segments and each segment is the first in sentences of a randomly selected document from the Brown corpus.
children.deskripsi_metode:
The goal of DPSO-SEG is to identify the optimal topic boundaries of the text segments in a document.  At first, the 
terms within each sentence are tokenized and stemmed. Then, generic stop words are removed.  After the basic 
preprocessing, each sentence is represented as a term-frequency vector. Then, sentence-sentence similarity 
between a pair of sentences is computed by cosine similarity. A sentence similarity matrix of the text then constructed using the sentence-sentence similarity. Finally, the optimal 
boundaries are created by DPSO according to the sentence similarity matrix.
children.hasil: The value of Pk is reduced sharply with fewer numbers of iterations, and smoothly after 350 iterations. It is converged at about 1500 iterations. the performance of DPSO-SEGC99 is better than DPSO-SEG. DPSO-SEGC99 also converges faster.

children.judul: Exploiting Constituent Dependencies for Tree Kernel-Based Semantic Relation Extraction
children.peneliti: Longhua Qian   Guodong Zhou   Fang Kong   Qiaoming Zhu   Peide Qian
children.masalah: Dynamically determine the tree span for relation extraction by exploiting constituent dependencies
children.deskripsi_masalah: Dynamically determine the tree span for relation extraction by exploiting constituent dependencies to integrate dependency information, which has been proven very useful to relation extraction, with the structured syntactic information to construct a concise and effective tree span specifically targeted for relation extraction. Explore interesting combined entity features for relation extraction via a unified parse and semantic tree.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: ACE RDC 2004 corpus as the benchmark data that contains 451 documents and 5702 relation instances. It defines 7 entity types, 7 major relation types and 23 subtypes
children.deskripsi_metode:
(1) Modification within base-NPs 
(2) Modification to NPs
(3)Arguments/adjuncts to verbs
(4)Coordination conjunctions
(5)Modification to other constituents
children.hasil: the improvements of different tree setups over SPT. DSPT performs best among DSPT, SPT, CS-SPT. It also shows that the Unified Parse and Semantic Tree with Feature-Paired Tree perform significantly better than the other two tree setups (i.e., CS-SPT and DSPT).

children.judul: Exploiting Background Knowledge for Relation Extraction
children.peneliti: Yee Seng Chan and Dan Roth
children.masalah: Supervised RE
children.deskripsi_masalah: Improve the performance of RE by considering the relationship between our relations of interest, as well as how they relate to some existing knowledge resources
children.deskripsi_domain_data: ACE-2004 dataset (catalog LDC2005T09 from the Linguistic Data Consortium) to conduct our experiments. ACE-2004 defines 7 coarse-grained relations and 23 fine-grained relations
children.deskripsi_metode: Using the coarse-grained predictions which should intuitively be more reliable, to improve the fine-grained predictions.Using Novel to contrain the predictions of the fine-grained.
children.hasil: Performing the usual evaluation on mentions gives similar performance figures. All the background knowledge helped to improve performance, providing a total improvement of 3.9 to our basic RE system. Improves the performance of coarse-grained relation predictions.

children.judul: First Order Statistics Based Feature Selection: A Diverse and Powerful Family of Feature Seleciton Techniques
children.peneliti: Taghi Khoshgoftaar, David Dittman, Randall Wald, and Alireza Fazelpour
children.masalah: First Order Statistics (FOS) based feature selection
children.deskripsi_masalah:
First Order Statistics (FOS) based feature selection using seven related univariate
feature selection metrics
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
The datasets are all DNA microarray datasets acquired from a number of different real world bioinformatics, genetics, and medical projects. Use datasets with two classes for example:
cancerous/non-cancerous or relapse/no relapse).
children.metode: Datasets, feature subset size, similarity measure, and classification
children.deskripsi_metode: Datasets, feature subset size, similarity measure, and classification
children.hasil: Twenty one possible pairwise comparisons only one combination is above a 0.7 similarity across all twelve feature subset sizes: Fold Change Difference and SAM. Outside of this pair only four other pairs (S2N and Welch T Statistic, Signal to Noise and SAM, Fold Change Difference and Fisher Score, and Welch T Statistic and SAM) achieve a similarity score above 0.7 and only the combination of Welch T Statistic and Fisher Score achieves this below a feature subset size of 500

children.judul: Relation extraction using dependency parse trees
children.peneliti: Katrin Fundel, Robert Ku¨ffner, Ralf Zimmer
children.masalah: Relation extraction from free text
children.deskripsi_masalah: The use of dependency parse trees as a means for biomedical relation extraction from free text. It is based on natural language preprocessing producing dependency parse trees and applying a small number of simple rules to these trees.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Synonym dictionary for genes/proteins, a training set (55 sentences and 103 interactions) and a test set (80 sentences and 54 interactions).
children.deskripsi_metode:
(1) effector-relation-effectee (‘A activates B’)
(2) relation-of-effectee-by-effector (‘Activation of A by B’)
(3) relation-between-effector-and-effectee (‘Interaction between A
and B’).
children.hasil:
HPRD, even though being a very large
and valuable source for protein interaction data, currently covers
only a small part of the human protein-protein relations from very limited relation categories. RelEx provides complementary information.

children.judul: Automatic Evaluation of Relation Extraction Systems on Large-scale
children.peneliti: Mirko Bronzi, Zhaochen Guo, Filipe Mesquita
children.masalah: Framework for large-scale evaluation of relation extraction systems
children.deskripsi_masalah:
Framework for large-scale
evaluation of relation extraction systems based on an automatic annotator that uses a public online database and a large web corpus.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Compare two open RE systems: ReVerb and SONEX. The input corpus for this comparison is the New York Times corpus, composed by 1.8 million documents. ReVerb  extracts relational phrases using rules over part-of-speech tags and noun-phrase chunks.
children.deskripsi_metode: Use of an automatic annotator: a system capable of verifying whether or not a fact was correctly extracted. This is done by leveraging external sources of data and text, which are not available to the systems being evaluated
children.hasil: About 63 million facts in G', the superset of the ground truth G.

children.judul: Confidence Estimation Methods for Partially Supervised Relation Extraction
children.peneliti: Eugene Agichtein
children.masalah: Extract structured relations between named entities
children.deskripsi_masalah: Extract structured relations between named entities (e.g., a company name, a location name, or a name of a drug or a disease) from unstructured documents with minimal human effort.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: Three relations extracted from a collection of 145,000 articles from the New York Times from 1996, available as part of the North American News Text Corpus1.
children.deskripsi_metode: Expectation Maximization (EM) algorithms for estimating pattern and tuple confidence.
children.hasil: The EM-based methods have higher accuracy than the constraint-based method

children.judul: A New Approach to Word Sense Disambiguation Based on Context Similarity
children.peneliti: M. Nameh, S.M. Fakhrahmad, M. Zolghadri Jahromi
children.masalah: Improve accuracy in WSD
children.deskripsi_masalah:
The human mind is able to select the proper target equivalent of any source language word by comprehension of the context.
In order to simulate this behavior in a machine, a huge amount of data will be required as input and the output may still not be free from errors.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: In order to evaluate the proposed scheme, we used TWA sense tagged data which is a benchmark corpus developed at University of North Texas by Mihalcea and Yang in 2003.
children.deskripsi_metode: Inner product of vectors algorithm. The proposed scheme is a supervised approach in which sense-tagged data is used to train the classifier.
children.hasil: The results are promising compared to the methods existing in the literature and were encouraging in most cases.

children.judul: Unsupervised Word Sense Disambiguation Using Neighborhood Knowledge
children.peneliti: Huang Heyan, Yang Zhizhuo, Jian Ping
children.masalah: context window size
children.deskripsi_masalah: It has been proved that expanding context window size around the target ambiguous word can help to enhance the WSD performance. However, expanding window size unboundedly will bring not only useful information but also some noise which may finally deteriorate the WSD performance.
children.deskripsi_domain_data: In the experiment, Sogou Chinese collocation relation was used to compute mutual information of words.
children.deskripsi_metode: This study proposes to construct an appropriate knowledge context for unsupervised WSD method by making use of a few neighbor sentences closed to the ambiguous sentence in the article.
children.hasil: The neighborhood knowledge can significantly improve the performance of single sentence WSD.

children.judul: Semi-supervised Relation Extraction with Large-scale Word Clustering
children.peneliti: Ang Sun, Ralph Grishman, Satoshi Sekine
children.masalah: Semi-supervised Relation Extraction with Large-scale Word Clustering
children.deskripsi_masalah: Cluster-based features in a systematic way ,several statistical methods for selecting effective clusters, impact of the size of training data on cluster features, analyze the performance improvements through an extensive experimental study.
children.deskripsi_domain_data:
We used TDT5 unlabeled data for 
inducing word clusters. It contains roughly 83 million words in 3.4 million sentences with a vocabulary size of 450K. We induced 1,000 word clusters for words that appeared at least twice in 
the corpora. The reduced vocabulary contains 255K unique words.For relation extraction, we used the benchmark ACE 2004 training data.
children.deskripsi_metode: Simple learning framework that is similar to the hierarchical learning strategy. Specifically, train a binary classifier to distinguish between relation instances and non-relation instances. Then use only the annotated relation instances to train a multi-class classifier for the 7 relation types.
